title: Discriminatory practices; breastfeeding
context: [PART II.] BREASTFEEDING IN PUBLIC ACCOMMODATIONS [ยง489-21] Discriminatory practices; breastfeeding. It is a discriminatory practice to deny, or attempt to deny, the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, privileges, advantages, and accommodations of a place of public accommodations to a woman because she is breastfeeding a child. [L 2000, c 227, pt of ยง2]
